messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Monty Python card game
messages.msgSnippet: We just recently introduced our kids to Monty Python. They had never heard of or seen a MP movie before. We watched the Holy Grail. They thought it was okay,
messages.messageBody:
We just recently introduced our kids to Monty Python. They had never heard
of or seen a MP movie before. We watched the Holy Grail. They thought it was
okay, my older son (almost 11) laughed and got more of the humor than my
younger son - Jonathan (9). DH (being a MP fan) was narrating and explaining
the various scenes that came up. And I think because he was cracking up at
certain parts, my kids knew that it was a funny part and they tried to find
the humor in it. They liked the killer white bunny (because we have a mean
white bunny). But at the end, when it abruptly ended with the untimely
arrests, Jonathan declared that in his opinion, Spongebob Squarepants was
much funnier and this was a stupid movie. BUT, I checked out The Life of
Brian (on DVD!) and we're watching that, next!

Karin

messages.subject: Monty Python card game
messages.msgSnippet: I found this site while I was searching around for something else. So what else is new? ;-) It s a Monty Python and the Holy Grail collectable card game.
messages.messageBody:
I found this site while I was searching around for something else. So what
else is new? ;-) It's a Monty Python and the Holy Grail collectable card
game. Thought some of your MP/gamer/quick wits might like it. Could be kinda
cool if done right.

http://members.aol.com/relkin/mphgmain.htm

~Mary
